title: Probability Tree Explorer
description: An interactive probability tree visualization for understanding compound probabilities when drawing balls without replacement, demonstrating why probabilities multiply along branches through proportional branch widths.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Mathematics
Probability
Statistics
learningObjectives: Calculate compound probabilities by tracing paths through a probability tree
Explain why probabilities multiply along branches
Distinguish between independent and dependent (conditional) probabilities
Analyze how removing items affects subsequent probabilities (without replacement)

controls.label: Red Balls
controls.description: Adjust the number of red balls in the bag

controls.label: Blue Balls
controls.description: Adjust the number of blue balls in the bag

controls.label: Reset
controls.description: Reset to default values (5 red, 3 blue)

controls.label: Show Calculations
controls.description: Toggle display of all outcome probabilities
Hover over outcome nodes to see detailed calculation

assumptions: Each ball equally likely to be drawn
